intro: Siparuna rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved siparuna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Siparuna rugosa is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical rainforests.
